The dashed vertical lines are the lower and upper bounds on ÃÅ½ÃÂ², which are incorporated as inequality moments.
We also use data from a special supplement to the January 1977 CPS. A subsample of survey respondents was asked additional questions regarding union status, earnings, and hours worked.

These individuals were also asked to provide the name and address of their employer. Their employers were subsequently asked to provide information for the survey respondent, including the aforementioned variables. For a more detailed discussion of this data, see Mellow and Sider (1983).
Using code graciously provided to us by Alan Krueger, we employ the same sample restrictions as Angrist and Krueger (1999).
